column1: List publications in the first column
***Research Reports - U.S. Census Bureau***
Thom File and Joey Marshall, LGBT Community Harder Hit by Economic Impact of Pandemic." U.S. Census Bureau. August 11
Lydia Anderson, Thomas File, Joey Marshall, Kevin McElrath and Zachary Scherer, How Do COVID-19 Vaccination and Vaccine Hesitancy Rates Vary Over Time?" U.S. Census Bureau. April 14
Joey Marshall, Charlynn Burd and Michael Burrows, Working From Home During the Pandemic." U.S. Census Bureau. March 31
***Research Reports - Pew Research Center***
Katayoun Kishi, Stephanie Kramer, Joey Marshall and Aleksandra Sandstrom, “Four facts about religion in New Zealand.” Pew Research Center. March 21, 2019. https://pewrsr.ch/2TmQQNE
Joey Marshall, “Are religious people happier, healthier? Our new global study explores this question.” Pew Research Center. January 31, 2019. https://pewrsr.ch/2MEWOYx
Pew Research Center, “Religion's Relationship to Happiness, Civic Engagement and Health Around the World.” January 31, 2019. https://pewrsr.ch/2HCWNp8
Joey Marshall, “The world's most committed Christians live in Africa, Latin America and the U.S.” Pew Research Center. August 22, 2018. https://pewrsr.ch/2w4C05A
Pew Research Center, “The Age Gap in Religious Commitment Around the World.” Pew Research Center. June 13, 2018. https://pewrsr.ch/2LOSh4j
***Peer-reviewed journal articles and chapters***

Daniel V. A. Olson, Jong Hyun Jung and **Joey Marshall**. 2020. "Sacred Canopies or Religious Markets? The Effect of County-level Religious Diversity on Later Changes in Religious Involvement." *Journal for the Scientific Study of Religion* **Co-winner of the 2021 Best Article Award from the International Society for the Sociology of Religion.**

Conrad Hackett, Marcin Stonawski, Michaela Potancoková, Phillip Connor, Anne Fengyan Shi, Stephanie Kramer and **Joey Marshall**. 2019. “Projections of
Europe’s Growing Muslim Population Under Three Migration Scenarios.” Journal of Religion and Demography 6(1): 87–122.
**Joey Marshall** and Daniel V. A. Olson. 2018. “Religious Context and Generalized Social Trust in the United States.” Journal for the Scientific Study of Religion 57(3): 473-494.

**Joey Marshall** and Daniel V. A. Olson. 2018. “Spiritual but not Religious' a Replacement for Religion or Just One Step on the Path Between Religion and Non-Religion?” *Review of Religious Research* 60(4): 503-518.

**Joey Marshall**. 2018. “Is Social Media Data Relevant for Religious Demographic Research?” *Yearbook of International Religious Demography 2018*, vol. 5, pp. 143-153. Edited by Brian Grim, Todd M. Johnson, Vegard Skirbekk and Gina Zurlo. Leiden, The Netherlands: Brill.

Michael T. Light and **Joey Marshall**, 2018. “On the Weak Mortality Returns of the Prison Boom: Comparing Infant Mortality and Homicide in the Incarceration Ledger,” *Journal of Health and Social Behavior*
***Book reviews***
**Joey Marshall**, 2016. “Globalization and the Making of Religious Modernity in China,” edited by Thomas Jansen, Thoralf Klein, and Christian Meyer, *Review of Religion and Chinese Society* 3(2).
